intro: Chuquiraga longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, narrow, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are typically hairy and robust. Chuquiraga longiflora is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in high-altitude environments.
